body.p: The Templates tab is available for DITA OT transformations with WebHelp Responsive or WebHelp Responsive with Feedback output types and it provides a set of predefined publishing templates. You can use one of them to publish your documentation or as a starting point for a new publishing template.

There are two main types of templates, Tiles and Tree and each of the built-in templates includes of version of each type. You can click on the tags at the top of the pane to filter the templates and narrow your search. You can filter them by either tiles or tree and then various color schemes. Each built-in template also includes an Online preview link that opens a webpage in your default browser that provides a sample of how the main page will look when that particular template is used to generate the output.

The two main types of layouts:
Tiles The main page in the WebHelp output presents a tile for each main topic (chapter) of the documentation. Each tile includes a link to the topic and a short description.
Tree The main page in the WebHelp output presents a tree-like table of contents with links to the first and second level topics in the publication.

section.title: Built-in Templates Location
section.p: All built-in templates are stored in the following directory: /templates.

section.title: Custom Templates
section.p: You can use a built-in template as a starting point for creating your own custom template. Once you are finished configuring your template, you can click the Choose Custom Publishing Template link to select your template.
You can also store your custom templates in a templates gallery. The templates stored in the gallery will be displayed as the first items in the Template tab.
To define your templates gallery, click the Configure Publishing Templates Gallery link and add the directory where your custom templates are stored to list.

section.title: Custom Template Errors
section.p: When the Templates tab is opened, all templates (built-in and custom) are loaded and validated. Specifically, certain elements in the template descriptor file are checked for validity. If errors are encountered that prevents the template from loading, the following message will be displayed toward the bottom of the dialog box:

If you click the More details link, a window will open with more information about the encountered error. For example, it might offer a hint for which element is missing from the expected descriptor file structure.
Also, if a valid preview image cannot be found, a warning icon () will be displayed on the template's image (in the Templates tab of the transformation dialog box).

section.title: Sharing Publishing Template
section.p: To share a publishing template with others, following these steps:

ol.li: Copy your template in a new folder.
Go to Options Preferences DITA Publishing and add that new folder to the list.
Switch the option as the bottom of that preferences page to Project Options.
